title: U.S.-Canada Energy Trade: Set for a Rebound
description: The CSIS Energy Security and Climate Change Program has partnered with the Embassy of Canada in the United States to produce a map depicting energy trade between the two countries.

title: The United Kingdom’s Offshore Wind Industrial Strategy
description: The United Kingdom considers offshore wind a major opportunity for economic growth in the country. The government’s strategy combines ambitious climate targets and offshore wind deployment goals with financial support and industry partnerships.

title: Sinpo South Shipyard Update: SLBM Test Launch
description: North Korea test-fired a “new type” of submarine-launched ballistic missile (SLBM) on October 19, 2021, from waters in the Sinpo area. The test launch of the new SLBM is one of a series of recent provocative missile tests that demonstrate advancements in the survivability...

title: The Evening: Vaccinating Children, Afghan Refugees, Muddy Stones, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Vaccinating Children, Afghan Refugees, Muddy Stones, and More.

title: Partnership 2020 Quarterly Newsletter
description: This quarterly newsletter serves as a way for college and university leaders, U.S. and Indian policymakers, and other relevant stakeholders to receive updates on Partnership 2020 work, new funding opportunities, policies, employment opportunities, and best practices in higher...

title: Middle East Notes and Comment: The Puzzle of U.S.-Saudi Ties
description: The Middle East Program's monthly newsletter for October, 2021.

title: Bringing Supply Chains Back to Mexico
description: A series of essays, written in collaboration between PIIE and CSIS, explore the feasibility and benefits of relocating supply chains to Mexico and shared Mexican-U.S. interest in building resilient supply chains in North America.

title: How the Assad Regime Systematically Diverts Tens of Millions in Aid
description: Natasha Hall, Karam Shaar, and Munqeth Othman Agha expose how tens of millions of aid dollars spent in Syria contribute directly to the regime’s Central Bank through a distorted exchange rate.

title: From Data to Insight: Making Sense out of Data Collected in the Gray Zone
description: While more data can provide actionable indications and warning, the U.S. government runs the risk of creating locked-up data silos rather than a comprehensive set of data-driven insights.

title: Camel Corruption Crackdown
description: As Saudi officials crack down on corruption, they are increasingly zeroing in on a new target: suspiciously full camel lips.

title: The Puzzle of U.S.-Saudi Ties
description: Jon Alterman tackles the ambivalent relationship between the United States and Saudi Arabia.

title: The Evening: Pfizer and 12-18s, IAEA Warns on Iran, Gallagher Brothers, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Pfizer and 12-18s, IAEA Warns on Iran, Gallagher Brothers, and More.
